rukus.text: Say: people of the book, come to a word that is common between us and between you, (which is) do not serve anything but God, and do not make anything (or anyone) His partner, and some of us do not take others as our masters besides God. And if they refuse, then say: be witness that we are submitted (to God)
People of the book, why do you argue about Abraham, when the Torah and the Gospel was not sent down until after him? Do you not understand
You are those who argued about what you had knowledge of, so why do you argue about things that you have no knowledge of? God knows and you do not know
Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was a submitted monotheist and he was not one of the polytheists
The closest people to Abraham are those who followed him and this prophet (Muhammad) and those who believed. God is the protector (and supporter) of the believers
And a group of the people of the book like to misguide you, but they only misguide themselves and they do not realize
People of the book, why do you disbelieve in Godâ€™s signs, while you testify
People of the book, why do you disguise the truth with falsehood, and you hide the truth while you know
